info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 4:22PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Benton and northeastern Decatur Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 421 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of New Johnsonville, or 9 miles south of Camden, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Camden, Holladay, I-40 Near The Tennessee River and Sugar Tree. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
